page.title: 05Religion - History continued
page.content: School had 80 scholars and 12 teachers There is a manuscript indicating that English as well as Welsh was used in Zion Ponthir in 1820, and in 1837, the sermons were given in both languages, English an Welsh. Welsh sermons were given in the morning, and English sermons in the evening. The church was renovated in the year 1901. Under the floor between the pulpit and the wall near the burial ground, is a well of water which was probably used to clean the church and baptise people. At the end of station road there is a small shed used as a garage today, but it was a place to keep the pony and trap of visiting ministers.
